channel.title: CVE Feed for NetIQ -- Access Manager
channel.description: The latest CVEs for NetIQ -- Access Manager

item.title: CVE-2017-14800|2024-08-05T19:34:40.340Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: A reflected cross site scripting attack in the NetIQ Access Manager before 4.3.3 using the "typecontainerid" parameter of the policy editor could allowed code injection into pages of authenticated users.

item.title: CVE-2017-14802|2024-08-05T19:34:39.997Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: Novell Access Manager Admin Console and IDP servers before 4.3.3 have a URL that could be used by remote attackers to trigger unvalidated redirects to third party sites.

item.title: CVE-2017-14801|2024-08-05T19:34:39.941Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: Reflected XSS in the NetIQ Access Manager before 4.3.3 allowed attackers to reflect back xss into the called page using the url parameter.

item.title: CVE-2017-9276|2024-08-05T17:02:44.180Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: Novell Access Manager iManager before 4.3.3 did not validate parameters so that cross site scripting content could be reflected back into the result page using the "a" parameter.

item.title: CVE-2017-7419|2024-08-05T16:04:11.275Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: A OAuth application in NetIQ Access Manager 4.3 before 4.3.2 and 4.2 before 4.2.4 allowed cross site scripting attacks due to unescaped "description" field that could be specified by the provider.

item.title: CVE-2017-14799|2024-08-05T19:34:40.366Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: A cross site scripting attack in handling the ESP login parameter handling in NetIQ Access Manager before 4.3.3 could be used to inject javascript code into the login page.
